author: etan_status
content: in python, it is represented with python's `typing.Optional`

author: potuz
content: Yeah we already have methods that have an optional return. What I don't know if this is all I need to do for the class member in the ssz container

author: etan_status
content: regular ssz container cannot have optional fields. only stablecontainer / profile can have optional fields

author: etan_status
content:
the way how it works is, you make the stablecontainer that defines the merkleization layout. inside that one, every field is optional.
then, you make a profile that's specific to prague / whatever fork you want to base ePBS on. inside the profile, you can mix and match required / optional / disallowed fields as you wish

author: etan_status
content:
example:

```python
    class Shape(StableContainer[4]):
        side: Optional[uint16]
        color: Optional[uint8]
        radius: Optional[uint16]

    class Square(Profile[Shape]):
        side: uint16
        color: Optional[uint8]

    class Circle(Profile[Shape]):
        color: Optional[uint8]
        radius: uint16
```

author: potuz
content: Ah perfect, thanks, this makes sense

author: etan_status
content: in this example, `side` always has `GeneralizedIndex(4)`, `color` is `5`, `radius` is `6`

author: n0price
content: One question is it possible that "attestation inclusion distance" to be 0?

author: potuz
content: no, an attestation for slot `N` can only be processed in slots `M` with `M > N`.

author: n0price
content: So there is no case that is 0?

author: potuz
content: no, in the above example, inclusion distance equals `M-N`

author: radekkapka
content: Attestation inclusion distance cannot be 0 because that would mean that a block contains attestations for itself. So you would attest for something that contains the attestation itself, which is illogical

author: n0price
content: Thanks <@308223150725005322> , this can vary if 1 indicates that the attestation is included not immediately in the next block but rather in the block following the one the attestation is attesting to.
